summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 regarding the scheduling of a briefing for the FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) to support the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) regarding the results of an Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigation into the original Epstein case. The briefing was scheduled for November 12, 2020, at the Miami Field Office, with a preparatory session on November 6.

persons.name: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division
persons.role: Program Manager, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: The sender of the initial email canvassing Victim Services Specialists (VSS) for their availability to assist in a briefing regarding the OPR investigation results in the Epstein case.

events.title: Preparatory Session for OPR Briefing
events.description: A mandatory session for Victim Services Specialists requested to participate in the November 12 briefing. Attendees were to block their calendar from 10am to 12pm.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

events.title: ODAG Briefing on OPR Investigation Results
events.description: A briefing at the Miami Field Office regarding the results of an Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigation into the original Epstein case, supported by the FBI Victim Services Division. The Deputy Director had approved VSD assistance.
personsInvolved: Program Manager FBI Victim Services Division

keyFacts: The FBI was organizing a briefing for November 12, 2020, regarding the results of an Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) investigation into the original Epstein case.
The briefing was to be supported by the FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD), with approval from the Deputy Director.
Victim Services Specialists who had assisted in Epstein briefings the previous fall were being canvassed for availability, indicating an ongoing victim support process.
The email confirms internal FBI and DOJ (ODAG) reviews and briefings related to the Epstein investigation were still occurring as of late 2020.
A mandatory preparatory session for the briefing was scheduled for November 6, 2020.
